flexboxData.name: Sri Lankan Junglefowl
flexboxData.description: The Sri Lankan junglefowl (Gallus lafayettii) is a member of the Galliformes bird order which is endemic to Sri Lanka, where it is the national bird. It is closely related to the Red junglefowl.

flexboxData.name: Sri Lankan Sloth Bear
flexboxData.description: The Sri Lankan sloth bear (Melursus ursinus inornatus) is a subspecies of the sloth bear which is found mainly in lowland dry forests in the island of Sri Lanka.

flexboxData.name: Sri Lanka Blue Magpie
flexboxData.description: The Sri Lanka blue magpie or Ceylon magpie (Urocissa ornata) is a brightly coloured member of the family Corvidae, found exclusively in Sri Lanka.

flexboxData.name: Purple-faced Langur
flexboxData.description: The Purple-faced Langur (Trachypithecus vetulus), also known as the Purple-faced leaf monkey, is a long-tailed arboreal monkey endemic to Sri Lanka.

flexboxData.name: Red-backed Flameback
flexboxData.description: The Red-backed flameback, Lesser Sri Lanka flameback, Sri Lanka red-backed woodpecker or Ceylon red-backed woodpecker (Dinopium psarodes) is a species of bird endemic to Sri Lanka.

flexboxData.name: Sri Lankan Krait
flexboxData.description: Bungarus ceylonicus, the Ceylon krait or Sri Lankan krait, is a species of venomous elapid snake which is endemic to the island Sri Lanka, locally known as මුදු කරවලා (mudu karawalaa).

locations.name: Yala National Park
locations.description: Yala National Park is the second-largest national park in Sri Lanka, located in the southeast part of the country. It is renowned for its diverse wildlife, including elephants, leopards, and a variety of bird species. The park is a popular destination for safari tours, offering visitors the chance to experience the beauty of Sri Lanka's natural landscapes and observe its rich biodiversity.

locations.name: Wilpattu National Park
locations.description: Wilpattu National Park is a sprawling wilderness in the northwest of Sri Lanka, named after the 'wilus' - a network of natural lakes that dot the landscape. It's the island's largest national park, encompassing over 130,000 hectares of dry lowland forest, grasslands, and wetlands.
